rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {MDC4201, MDC4202, MDC4215, MDC4216, MDC5201, MDC5215}
Must be enrolled in course version {F6002}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {MDC4110}

description: This unit advances knowledge, methods and principles in interaction design and focuses on furthering the practical and conceptual skills developed in preceding units. In the studio students will be exposed to a broad range of interactive system design methods from holistic thinking and operational thinking to self-organization, and will explore the significance and complexity of contextualization required in systemic approaches in the design process. A major design project encourages students to develop research skills and experience in applying methods and principles of system design to solve complex interaction design issues.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
